instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
820-3437-B not turn on orange light.
Not turning on , no fan , green and orange light.
PPBUS_G3H = 8.5v=8.6
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.5v=8.6
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS = 8.5v=
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 14.9v=16.49
PPDCIN_G3H = 14.9v=

PP3V42_G3H = 3.42v=3.42
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.32v=3.3

PP5V_S5 = 5v=5
PP3V3_S5 = 3.32v=3.3
PP3V3_S4 = 3.32v=0 ?????????????????

PP5V_S4RS3 = Dead / Pulsing=0
PP5V_S0 = Dead / Pulsing=0
PPVCC_S0_CPU = Dead / Pulsing=0
No fan spin at all.
Any help please.
Thanks.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: I don't understand what mean the 2 list values...

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: Could you please specify which list you don't understand ?  specially this value  PP3V3_S4 = 3.32v=0  , i don't know from where i should check next? Thanks.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
You've posted two values for each power line, why???

And no need to measure the same power rail in different points.
Do you really expect to get different voltage between  PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS and  PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS ?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: "Do you really expect to get different voltage between PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS and PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS ? " You are absolutely right. Just wasting of time. Never happened again. So any other suggestions?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
I think 2informaticos is right, what does "PP3V3_S4 = 3.32v=0" mean ? Do you actually get 3.32V or 0V on PP3V3_S4 rail, it's not clear.
I'm going to assume that your PP3V3_S4 is missing. Can you check S4_PWR_EN ?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
Sorry for that stupid job. Here is the right one :
PPBUS_G3H = 8.5v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.5v
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS = 8.5v
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 16.49
PPDCIN_G3H = 14.9v

PP3V42_G3H = 3.42v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.32v

PP5V_S5 = 5v
PP3V3_S5 = 3.32v
PP3V3_S4 = 0 
 Hi Fanfwe  S4_PWR_EN  =0.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
Did you try known good LIO flex/board?
Also inspect J9500 pins.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
This is known good i/o flex /board.
Clean j9500 pins. 
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time is .36v

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse at same time; check that.
Be sure PM_RSMRST_L is high.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse 3.3 v  at same time and became 0v
PM_RSMRST_L  also pulse 3.3 and became 0v. and fan is turn on.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: PM_RSMRST_L must be high all the time!

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: yes it is  PM_RSMRST_L  high all the time.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
"PM_RSMRST_L  also pulse 3.3 and became 0v"
Can you clarify???

"fan is turn on"
Fan remains on, or just pulses?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
PM_RSMRST_L also pulse 3.3  all time.
Fan just pulse.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
Please post clear and accurate information!
PM_RSMRST_L pulses, or is steady 3.3V???

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: PM_RSMRST_L  IS STEADY 3.3V.

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
If you get pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, check for pulse at all S3 voltages.
Same, if PM_SLP_S3_L pulses, check all S0 voltages.

Can you catch pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_L=0V

S4_PWR_EN =0V

PM_SLP_S3_L=0V

pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950 are both 0v

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse 3.3 v  at same time and became 0v"
Looks like you got pulse on them...

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: yes i got pulse on them , do you think it could be PCH issue?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
Ten check for pulse on corresponding voltages, controlled by these signals.
Do you get pulse at pins 1, 7 & 3 of U1950?

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message:
I have got the same board same problems too. But I see that it has been cutted off here :) So I dont know where to look more. I have steady 3.0V on  PM_RSMRST_L too no fan spin. And I have pulse on Smc Trigger too. Until the end of 1st page of this post, everything is same. 
First I got pulse on 1, 7 & 3 of U1950 but then suddenly the fan started working. We took the magsafe cable out and put back again. Then I didnt get any pulse anymore from them and also  PM_SLP_Sx_L  lines

threads.title: 820-3437-B not turn on, green and  orange light.
threads.message: Please, open new thread with your problem...
